alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 08 at 1:19AM CST until January 08 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions over the southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande plains Today... .A strong cold front will bring very gusty west to northwest winds and low humidity to the southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande plains today. In addition, drought and freeze cured fuels along with the low humidity and gusty conditions will result in pockets of high fire danger over the Rio Grande plains, mainly south of Del Rio. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Edwards; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
